body:
The "index.yaml" for a chart repository, currently contains in the full **url** for each chart, however the "repo_url" is already available in the "repositories.yaml" for the given repository.

The repo_url is required by the "helm repo index" command to create the index.yaml

Having the full url for each chart:
- Prevents portability of the repository
- It is not always clear where a "private" repository will be hosted when indexing it
- DNS lookup may expose the repository at a different URL
- Relocation or replication of the repository is not possible without re-indexing
- Generally, it is less flexible to duplicate the host repo url in the repo index metadata

Other software packaging and repository solutions, for example "yum" do not hard-code the host repo url in the repository metadata.
### Current behaviour

`$ helm repo index test_repo`
`Error: This command needs 2 arguments: path to a directory, url of chart repository`
`$ head test_repo/index.yaml`
`alpine-0.1.0:`
`name: alpine`
`url: http://localhost:8879/charts/alpine-0.1.0.tgz`
### Wanted Behaviour:

`$ helm repo index test_repo`
`$ head test_repo/index.yaml`
`alpine-0.1.0:`
`name: alpine`
`url: alpine-0.1.0.tgz`
- "repo index" does not require the host repo_url, to index the repo
- chart fetching logic should support relative URLs for the chart url field in the index.yaml
title: "helm repo index" requires the hosted repo url to be provided
